div.head: TO HIS WORTHY AND well-deseruing friend Master A. D. B.

lg.l: MOst truly hast thou showne the diffrence great
Betwixt a Country life and Courtly seate,
That euery calling subiect is to Fate,
As well the Priuate life as Publike state,
By vice or vertue, Both, to trie and chuse;
Good, Bad; Best, Worst; as we them vse, abuse:
To teach all men, since, all mens states are such,
Nor Court, nor Cart, to loue, to loath, too much.
